gcci.text: The H100 rental price at $3.17/hour reflects a maturing GPU supply chain where overcapacity from delayed hyperscaler deployments is driving rental rates below initial premium levels, creating headroom for expanded inference workloads.

gtpi.text: Input token pricing at $1.25/1M signals aggressive API commoditization as providers leverage MoE architectures to compress inference costs, forcing smaller players to either specialize or exit the pricing war.

gagl.text: AI infrastructure's 120 TWh annual consumption represents 8-10% of total US data center load, indicating grid operators must accelerate nuclear and renewable integration to prevent regional capacity constraints by 2026.

aipi.text: The AI sector exhibits classic bubble characteristics with revenue multiples expanding faster than fundamental adoption metrics, suggesting institutional investors are pricing in irreversible structural shifts rather than near-term profitability.
